climbs.name: Sandromeda
climbs.fa: FA: Neil Chelton, Keiko Tanaka, Joe Shultz, Crusher Bartlett, 10/25/2018

content.description:
P1. Climb a hairline crack through the gray band to more broken rock, aiming for a crack in a roof.  Trend slightly right, to a hole and then to a ledge and 2-bolt belay (A3+, 130’).

P2: Gain the wide crack to the right then work up and right around the arete (communication difficult) and up a rotten crack system to a 2-bolt belay (A3, 120’).

P3: Continue upward, through a roof to a thin headwall then to a 2-bolt belay under a protruding flake (A3, 100’).

P4: Nail around and mantel onto the “coffin.” Continue up the splitter crack above to a large ledge and a 2-bolt belay (A2+, 80’).

P5: Climb to the summit (no anchor) (A1 or 5.8, 25’).

Descent: Reverse the final pitch, single-rope rappel to the top of P2, rappel to the ground with two 70m ropes.
content.protection: Gear: A dozen or more Peckers/Beaks, selection pitons including Spectres, 4 sets of cams 0.4-#3 Camalot, 2 sets of cams to 6”, 2 sets of stoppers.
content.location: This is a hundred yards west of Scarlet Spire.  Begin on the west side, just left of the prow, at a dihedral.
